intro: Erythrococca paxii, commonly known as the red cocculus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Randiaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, smooth, orange fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
